subject: Economics
title: Industrialization: The Ladder Every Rich Nation Climbed
description: A quick win: understand Industrialization: The Ladder Every Rich Nation Climbed.

hook.text: Every country that became rich did it through manufacturing.

buildup.text: Manufacturing transforms low-skill agricultural workers into higher-productivity factory workers.

discovery.text: Manufacturing has a unique property: it absorbs low-skilled workers AND shows unconditional convergence.

climax.text: If manufacturing is no longer the path to prosperity, developing countries need a new playbook.

punchline.text: Every rich country climbed the manufacturing ladder.

quiz.question: What is 'premature deindustrialization'?
options: Developing countries losing manufacturing jobs to automation before achieving high income, removing the traditional path to prosperity
